description: From Old French porfiler, from Latin pro- + filum (“thread”). Doublet of profile.

entries.meaning: An ornamental border on clothing, furniture or a violin; beading, stringing.
(heraldry) An ornament consisting of a bordure of ermines, furs, etc. or gold studs or mountings.

verbs.description: purfle (third-person singular simple present purfles, present participle purfling, simple past and past participle purfled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To decorate (wood, cloth etc.) with a purfle or ornamental border; to border.
examples: It came to pass on a certain day, as he stood about the street leaning idly upon his crate, behold, there stood before him an honourable woman in a mantilla of Mosul silk, broidered with gold and bordered with brocade; her walking shoes were also purfled with gold and her hair floated in long plaits.

entries.meaning: (heraldry, transitive) To ornament with a bordure of ermines, furs, etc. or with gold studs or mountings.
